review_body: This is a great little hotel. We’ve been to Tokyo many times and we were looking for something different, not in the centre of town. The room was comfy, good size, enough room to keep suitcases out. The bar was nice and reasonably priced. The Koenji neighbourhood is cool and we went to a hotel recommended katsu place for dinner, it was delicious. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Overall very good. I recommend bringing eyepatches as the exit sign in the room was very bright.

It was a great experience for me to stay in art room (first experience).Adding to the greatness of the room I stayed in and posted here, the bar equiped on the first floor was so nice. There is a local community and I could talk with various types of people. I enjoyed.

On our last night in Tokyo my boyfriend and I wanted to stay in a different, less central neighborhood of Tokyo to get a different feel. We discovered BnA Hotel Koenji when searching for boutique hotels and loved that the rooms were decorated by artists and that part of the proceeds of the room revenue is donated to artists. We arrived around 2:45 on a Monday and were greeted by someone who may have been a cleaning person who was friendly but wouldn’t let us go to our room because “check-in wasn’t until 3pm.” Didn’t matter that we were 15 minutes from 3pm and no one was in the room, we had to leave and come back. It was pouring with rain and given that there isn’t a typical lobby where we could sit and wait we left feeling a bit weird. When we arrived back later that afternoon we were greeted by a woman who I assume works at the hotel and were shown our room. The art was awesome and we were impressed by the spaciousness and design of the room, and loved the wolf murals. The bathroom is pretty modern and there are tons of usb outlets for all your devices. We were a bit worried about the bar/dj situation in terms of noise but as it was a Monday night it was luckily quiet. It’s a little weird checking out of a hotel with an empty bar but it was pretty seamless. If you have an issue there’s a bell you can ring outside that I think is connected to a cell phone and someone can assist within a few minutes. The Koenji neighborhood is pretty cool, filled with tons of vintage shops and bars. The Koenji JR station is literally a two minute walk from the hotel and you can access Shinjuku and Tokyo station directly from the line at Koenji station. So easy! Overall this is a cool hotel for someone who is looking for more of a local experience in Tokyo while still being able to access more central areas easily and quickly with the nearby JR station.

I loved the BnA hotel and really loved the Koenji neighborhood. The hotel is located right outside the subway stop, which was so nice - and the hotel was surprisingly quiet! We had the room on the second floor - it was so cool to wake up to the brightly-colored mural every morning. The room was the perfect size for 2 people - it was small and there was no TV, but who cares about that?? We did not come to Koenji to sit in the room!The staff is very friendly and helpful and enthusiastic. Definitely hang out at the bar one night!!As far as Koenji goes, it is the best neighborhood in Tokyo! There are endless amounts of boutiques, vintage shops, restaurants and coffee shops - it was honestly hard to decide where to eat! Great yakatori spots and great craft beer bars! Japub was cool - they let people come in and DJ, which gave it a cool neighborhood vibe. My favorite boutique in Koenji was Kiki - definitely go check it out! Overall, I LOVED BnA and loved Koenji - just a fun, young, hip, friendly place :)

The BnA Project is an incredible hub of creative activity in the Koenji neighborhood of Tokyo. There are few places in the city (and country) like it. The rooms, live-in pieces of art, leave you inspired and the bar downstairs offers a chance to meet the artists themselves over a beer or two. If you're looking to exchange ideas, connect with fellow creatives and keep up with great events in the neighborhood, definitely check out BnA. Awesome staff who not only takes care of your stay, but adds to your experience in the neighborhood with recommendations, event invitations, introductions and more. Rooms are clean, well-furnished, and very spacious for Toyko with lots of light . Highly recommend the BnA Project - you'll leave as not only a guest, but a friend as well.

My first night in Tokyo, and one of the best during my trip. The atmosphere is incredible... the art, the music, the lights, everything.I met the conceptor and the manager, they made me feel very welcome, and listen to how passionate they are for their job and the place, for me was one of the most inspiring experiences I had in the country. Thank you BnA!

Amazing location 2 minutes walk from Koenji Station which has excellent connections into Shinjuku and Tokyo Stations for the Narita express. Entrance is through a bar - no Reception Area. Only 2 rooms. We stayed in the first floor room. Whacky to the extreme but comfortable. Good shower and reasonably comfortable single beds. Unfortunately on our first night they had a party in the bar and the music was vibrating into the room. On top of that there are air conditioning units outside of the window which hum all night long. So if you need complete quietness to sleep don't stay here. There are lots of trendy restaurants nearby. The hotel "guide book" gives excellent recommendations. Give a particular shout for a tempura one where they serve tempura eggs - expect to queue - but worth it.

This place has been permanently etched in our memory as one of the best places we have ever stayed at. From the reception bar, the Artpiece rooms to the rooftop terrace, its difficult to want to leave at times. A must if you are in koenji. We are definitely swinging by again next time we come to Tokyo.

Stayed here for 2 nights with my wife as something a bit different and was pleasantly surprised. The rooms are amazing, but the best part of the experience was being able to meet heaps of amazing people as the downstairs bar functions as a hub for local and international creative people. Highly recommended.

After staying at an amazing 5 star hotel our first few days in Tokyo we decided to stay at BnA Hotel on the tail end of our Japan trip to see a new part of town that is very cool and different. With just 2 rooms the BnA hotel is very laid back and hidden behind the ground floor coffeeshop and bar popular with hip foreigners. The recommendation guide in our room was great and the owner was friendly and welcoming. I'd recommend this hotel to fairly independent travelers that appreciate local hotels with a hip vibe.

We stumbled across this gem of a hotel via a lifestyle website and booked instantly. The concept and execution is second to none and we couldn't wait to stay here. The staff were extremely friendly, helpful and made us feel very welcome. The room was spacious, beautifully designed and very comfortable. Every detail has been thought through and yet it is completely unique! We can't wait to to return and/or explore more of their locations!

Awesome place! Very comfortable and inspiring place. There are also gallery and bar (coffee shop) on 1F. The bar (in night) and coffee stand (morning to evening) are also good. Good alcohol when checkin and good coffee when checkout!

We stayed here for three nights while in Tokyo. The amazing art work in the rooms was what drew us to this place. We had such a comfortable stay here, the room was fresh, the beds were so comfortable, we woke up every morning and just stared for a while at the artwork that filled the room. The bar downstairs was great for a drink or two with a great atmosphere and the bar man was so hospitable and spoke really good English. It closed by midnight and we couldn't hear any bar noise from our room. The Koenji neighbourhood is a very alternative area, a cool place to be in Tokyo. The hotel is very close to the train station which is handy, it's on the JR line so you can use your JR rail pass. I can not fault this place, a great experience.

Staying at BnA Hotel was one of the highlights of our trip. We loved the room, and the staff was incredible. Akira and Taz were so friendly and so helpful, and the room came with a booklet that helped us get to know Koenji. It ended up being one of our favorite areas of Tokyo, thanks to their recommendations! I honestly can't stress enough how incredible the whole experience was. The room was the perfect size, modern, and clean. AND the hotel was right next to the Koenji station, so it was SO easy to get around all of Tokyo. Stay here, and make sure you take some time to have drinks downstairs and talk to Akira.

Everything about BnA Koenji is cool. If you're contemplating staying here, don't think twice. It's literally a one minute walk to the Koenji station, so no need to stay in one of the "better known" and more expensive touristy neighborhoods (since you have to take the subway everywhere you go to anyways in Tokyo, better to be in a cool local neighborhood). Koenji has everything you need for your base in Tokyo, including a supermarket and hundreds of little izakayas all within walking distance of BnA. Both Taz (owner) and Akira (manager) were awesome, and will give you excellent advice on cool things to do and places to eat that are not touristy (if that's your thing). The rooms are small, but clean, new, and well-appointed, and you really just need a comfortable bed to sleep in, since you're out and about all day. The little bar to hang out in downstairs, the tiny gallery space in the basement, and the rooftop area all make this place fun and unique. Highly recommended!

I stayed with a friend in room 1, "into the wild". The location was perfect not even a minute from the station. We were lucky enough to be there on a day when the owners were arranging a rooftop party that we were invited to. The overall experience was great with really cool staff, a room that was a fantastic piece of art and you felt even better about it after finding out that the artist gets a share of the earnings from the rent!

Koenji is a great area. And this is a great little hotel. Two cool rooms. A tiny art gallery in the basement and a neat roof with graffiti by various artists. Right near train station and tons of cool restaurants. Nice cafe on ground floor with simple but tasty lunches.

Our stay at the Bed and Art was the best experience throughout Tokyo City. We were blown away by the amount of detail that went into creating this space. Every detail has been carefully thought about.We were also surprised to find out that the business model for the place was very social and highly collaborative, ensuring talented artists are well represented and shared part of the profit. We felt good spending in such a place knowing we were contributing to a cause and supporting local talent.The room was very spacious and mesmerizing to be inside, just staring at the canvas on the wall took our minds off the hustle and bustle of the city. Being a builder myself, I appreciated how the interior design including the lighting and furniture fit perfectly.The only negative thing about the place is it made us so at home we sometimes forgot to check out the rest of the city centre.

If you're looking for something different than your average hotel or Ikea furniture airbnb, this place is great. The art is just fantastic and you won't stay in a place like these anywhere else. The proprietors are also creative, inspiring people that want to support local artists through this project.Koenji is a neighbor more off the beaten tourist path that will give you a more local Toyko experience, but it's still very accessible by train and easy to get anywhere you want to go.

We stayed in the BnA Hotel for two days and had an amazing time. The guys who run the place are all really nice and we had a lot of fun drinking with them. The rooms are beautiful and it's obvious that a lot of care and attention has been put in to make the stay as special as possible. It's super close to the station as well and Koenji is a great area for exploring and really close to the Nakano broadway. :D
user_name:
Mörny W
Kuala Lumpur, Wilayah Persekutuan, Malaysia

review_body: I stumbled upon BNA during my visit to Tokyo for an art exhibition. A friend mentioned this place to me and the extremely friendly staff welcomed me as soon as I stepped foot into the hotel. Each room is designed by a different artists and they're all exceptionally beautiful. I stopped in just in time for an art event with food and drink. It was such a great experience that I'm marking this hotel as a must each time I visit Tokyo. It truly felt like home with such a great location. Delicious food was nearby, convenient stores, and a close by train station. Looking forward to seeing everyone again!

I found BnA on AirBnB and booked it for my trip in Tokyo and am now a huge fan! I can't wait to come back. The Koenji location is located right by the train station and is in an excellent location. The rooms are beautifully designed, very clean and the artwork is fantastic. Staying here was a really unique experience, the owners and concept behind BnA are wonderful as well. The front desk / bar is located on the lower level, a great place to meet fellow creatives and travelers. They also give a PDF / Map of recommended places to see / things to do for a artsy Tokyo experience that was very helpful and lead me to many cool spots.

A friend recommended I stay here and I could not have been more pleased. It felt like I was staying at a private artist hotel. Our room was perfect and well kept. Koenji is not an area we would have visited if we weren't staying there but it turned out to be our favorite neighborhood in all of Tokyo. This is the best experience I can imagine for coming to Tokyo and getting a local art inspired experience. We will be back!

Bed n Art Hotel located one blk from Koenji station. From north exit head towards Lawson on left side and walk one short block. BnA Hotel is on your right at the corner opposite Hotto Motto. Check in at the bar. This is a brand new artistic mini boutique hotel with a small funky bar and only two rental units. Unique artwork in each unit was painted by local artists which can be enjoyed while standing or laying in bed. Our unit on second floor was painted by Yohei Takahashi titled "into the foreign(unknown)". The other room on the third floor was painted by Ryuichi Ogino entitled "ten". Our room was compact, funky and modern decor but very functional with basic amenities-Air cond/heater, Panasonic bidet toilet, mini fridge, kettle, twin beds, large shower stall, shoe rack, hair dryer. WIFI weak at times. Even has AC power and USB receptacle in the centre table. In the evening, you can enjoy a drink or two and conversation in English with the congenial bar tender. From the south station exit, turn right and you'll find the Koenji PAL arcade shopping mall.
